progetto.network.socket

Class SocketClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • progetto.network.socket.SocketClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, INetworkClient

    public final class SocketClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements INetworkClient
    A socket client is a implementation of INetwork client, it is used on the client side to communicate with the server

      • sendRequest

        public void sendRequest(IRoomRequest request)
        Specified by:
        sendRequest in interface INetworkClient
        Parameters:
        request - request to be sent, implementation ensures that it will be sent to the higher level only after the requests already sent.

      • getEnforceCallback

        public Callback<IEnforce> getEnforceCallback()
        Specified by:
        getEnforceCallback in interface INetworkClient
        Returns:
        the callback that is called every time a enforce is received by the network. Implementer must ensure that enforcers are received in order.

      • onTearDown

        protected final void onTearDown()
        called when the connection gets closed.

      • getConnectionClosedCallback

        public final Callback<progetto.network.socket.AbstractSocket> getConnectionClosedCallback()
        Returns:
        the callback that is called when the timer signals that we are out of max time.

      • getMessageCallback

        public final Callback<java.lang.String> getMessageCallback()
        Returns:
        the callback that is called every time a text message is received.

      • isRunning

        public final boolean isRunning()
        Returns:
        true if the socket exists, is not disconnected, is not closed and is alive

      • disconnect

        disconnects from the network
        Parameters:
